alert.note: Alert for Gogebic (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 7:43PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Black River near Bessemer affecting Gogebic County. .While river levels continue to recede, high water along the Black River near Bessemer is still ongoing. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by rain and snowmelt continue. * WHERE...Black River near Bessemer. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Which is flood stage...water impacts low lying areas of properties along Black River Road and Hedberg Road * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 5.2 feet Sunday morning. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Monday morning at 1045 AM CDT.
